meanings.definition: To surpass in walking speed or distance.
meanings.sent1: She outwalks her friends during their hikes in the park.
meanings.sent2: He always outwalks his dog when they go for a stroll.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outwalk him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outwalk her previous record led her to victory in the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah effortlessly outwalks any other animal in the savanna.

meanings.definition: To walk faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The young athlete outwalks his competitors in every race.
meanings.sent2: During the race, she managed to outwalk her opponent by a significant margin.
meanings.sent3: The snail tried to outwalk the ant in the garden race but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outwalk his fears propelled him towards success.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner outwalks the competition with her consistent training and dedication.
